content.text:
Mr. McCONNELL. Mr. President, I ask unanimous consent that the Senate 
proceed to the immediate consideration of H.R. 3031, which was received 
from the House.
content.speaker: Mr. McCONNELL

content.text: The PRESIDING OFFICER. The clerk will report the bill by title.
content.speaker: The PRESIDING OFFICER

content.text:
The legislative clerk read as follows:

       A bill (H.R. 3031) to amend title 5, United States Code, to 
     provide for flexibility in making withdrawals from a Thrift 
     Savings Plan account, and for other purposes.
content.speaker: The RECORDER

content.text: There being no objection, the Senate proceeded to consider the bill.
content.speaker: The RECORDER

content.text:
Mr. McCONNELL. Mr. President, I ask unanimous consent that the bill 
be considered read a third time and passed and the motion to reconsider 
be considered made and laid upon the table.
content.speaker: Mr. McCONNELL

content.text:
The PRESIDING OFFICER. Without objection, it is so ordered.
  The bill (H.R. 3031) was ordered to a third reading, was read the 
third time, and passed.
content.speaker: The PRESIDING OFFICER
